sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Collaborative Process Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Collaborative Process Act.

sections.heading: Applicability. This Act applies to a collaborative process participation agreement that meets the requirements of Section 15 signed on or after the effective date of this Act
sections.text: Applicability. This Act applies to a collaborative process participation agreement that meets the requirements of Section 15 signed on or after the effective date of this Act.

sections.heading: Beginning and concluding the collaborative process.
sections.text: Beginning and concluding the collaborative process.

sections.heading: Proceedings pending before a court; status report.
sections.text: Proceedings pending before a court; status report.

sections.heading: Emergency order. Nothing in the collaborative process may prohibit a party from seeking an emergency order to protect the health, safety, welfare, or interest of a party or person identified as protected in Section 201 of the Illinois Domestic Violence Act of 1986, or may prohibit a party or nonpart
sections.text: Emergency order. Nothing in the collaborative process may prohibit a party from seeking an emergency order to protect the health, safety, welfare, or interest of a party or person identified as protected in Section 201 of the Illinois Domestic Violence Act of 1986, or may prohibit a party or nonparty participant from making a report of abuse, neglect, abandonment, or exploitation of a child or adult under the law of this State.

sections.heading: Approval of agreement by the court
sections.text: A court may approve an agreement resulting from a collaborative process. An agreement resulting from the collaborative process shall be presented to the court for approval if the agreement is to be enforceable.

sections.heading: Disclosure of information. Voluntary informal disclosure of information related to a matter is a defining characteristic of the collaborative process
sections.text: Except as provided by law other than this Act, during the collaborative process, on the request of another party, a party shall make timely, full, ca

sections.heading: Standards of professional responsibility and mandatory reporting not affected. This Act does not affect:
sections.text: Standards of professional responsibility and mandatory reporting not affected. This Act does not affect:

sections.heading: Confidentiality of collaborative process communication
sections.text: A collaborative process communication is confidential to the extent agreed by the parties in a signed record or as provided by law of this State other than this Act.

sections.heading: Privilege against disclosure for collaborative process communication; admissibility; discovery.
sections.text: Privilege against disclosure for collaborative process communication; admissibility; discovery.

sections.heading: Authority of the Illinois Supreme Court. This Act is subject to the supervisory authority of the Illinois Supreme Court.
sections.text: Authority of the Illinois Supreme Court. This Act is subject to the supervisory authority of the Illinois Supreme Court.
